Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Represents a field of an ASP.NET mobile control. This class cannot be inherited. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A field is of type ObjectListField. When you want to display multiple fields, you can specify multiple fields for each item in an object list. To create a field within the declaration of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>, you declare an ObjectListField as a `<Field>` element. Each field is associated with a property name. When a list item is bound to a data object, each field is bound to the corresponding property of the object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> provides three ways to define a field:
- Declaratively, by using `<Field>` child elements within the object list
- Programmatically, by constructing ObjectListField objects and adding them to the Fields member collection of the control
- Automatically, by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AutoGenerateFields%2A> property to `true`.
## Examples For a complete example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> overview.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DataBindItem(int32 fieldIndex, class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: Indicates which data value in the to bind.
Item in the containing the fields you want to bind to.
Docs.summary: Binds the field of the specified item to its corresponding data. Called internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets or sets the name of the property from which to bind data. The value must be set to ensure data binding. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The name of the property from which to bind data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The property must be of a primitive type, or of type string, `DateTime`, `Currency`, or `Decimal`.

Docs.returns: The name of the property from which to bind data.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the formatting string to use when formatting a data-bound value. The default is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The formatting string to use when formatting a data-bound value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The format of this string follows the conventions of the run-time <xref:System.String.Format%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. If you leave this property set to its default value, the data is converted by using the default `ToString` converter.

Docs.returns: The formatting string to use when formatting a data-bound value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the specified object. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The name of the object list field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use either the Name or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListField.DataField%2A> property to find an individual field within its parent collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns the first matching field; therefore, it is important that you use unique field names.

Docs.returns: The name of the object list field.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the title of the specified field. The default value is an empty . This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For devices that support a title separate from the page content, you can render the title as part of the form.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the specified control is rendered. The default value is . If the Visible property is set to , the control and its children are not rendered.
